page.title: 17Sampford Spiney Church
page.content: There is one church in this area at Sampford Spiney - St Mary's, which dates from 1250 AD. It formerly belonged to Plympton Priory, the arms of which religious house may be seen on the south face of the tower. They are carved on a stone at the side of a large window, two keys crossed. The pinnacles which rise from the angles of the tower are perpendicular. This parish of about 120 people is now joined ecclesiastically with the neighbouring parish of Horrabridge which means that fewer services are held in the church tshan a few years ago.
